Description:
CLOSE TO THE HEART....
Located between Bendigo C.B.D and La Trobe University, this classic Californian bungalow retains many original features including high decorative ceilings, lead light windows, hardwood timber floors and a cosy open fireplace.
- 3 spacious bedrooms.
- Generous lounge with art deco open fireplace.
- Kitchen with gas cooking/separate dining room.
- Bathroom with shower over bath, gas heating, r/c split system.
- Timber alfresco entertaining deck, single lock up garage.
Perfect for first home buyers and investors alike available with vacant possession.

Description:
BLUE CHIP DEVELOPMENT PROPERTY WITH PLANNING PERMIT
Located in this highly sought after position, within close proximity to Bendigo's CBD, is this outstanding property which comprises a two bedroom residence on a large 1080m2 (approx.) allotment.
Builders and developers are encouraged to enquire about the council approved planning permit for a 3 Lot subdivision (requiring removal of existing dwelling), along with endorsed plans for new residences.
Educational and recreational facilities, plus a major supermarket are all within walking distance.
The existing residence offers comfortable living, and provides the added bonus of being able to provide a rental return for those who wish to hold the property for future development.

Description:
Spacious Family Home on Large Allotment!
Set at the end of a quiet court is this neat and tidy home offering picturesque views across Kennington! This home has been freshly painted throughout and offers more than enough space for the growing family. Features of this home include; a large open plan lounge and dining area, this living space is situated in the centre of the home, perfect for family living, there is a separate living/study space and a well-designed kitchen with meals area. The kitchen offers an abundance of cupboards, an electric wall oven, a dishwasher, long work bench and two by two-door built-in pantries. This home is equipped with ducted heating throughout and a split system for cooling.
There are three spacious bedrooms, the main with a built-in robe, ceiling fan and an ensuite, the remaining two bedrooms each have built in robes and are also of a great size. The central bathroom offers a bath with box-bay window overlooking a fernery, shower and separate toilet. The laundry is also a very generous size and offers plenty of room for added storage.
The family dining area allows sliding door access to the large established yard, which offers a brick-paved alfresco area overlooking the pool and wonderful tree-top views. The low maintenance lawn and garden beds make general maintenance a breeze! There is also a garden shed for added storage. The double lock up garage also allows backyard access.
This fabulous location is sure to be a popular choice, the Kennington Reservoir, schools and La Trobe University are within walking distance. The Strath Hill & Kennington Village shopping centres are also all an easy walk. All transportation is within walking distance as well - you couldn't ask for a better location!
Insights: 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Endless Opportunities
In the heart of Kennington sits this beautifully presented Californian Bungalow within walking distance to Bendigo Centre, La Trobe University and Strath Village.
The home features ornate ceiling roses, decorative cornice, French doors and timber floorboards in keeping with the era. The open kitchen and dining are the center of the home. A great space to entertain family and friends. A formal lounge located at the front of the home allows flexible options in family life. The two bedrooms are complimented by the recently refurnished bathroom. The home office located off the dining area has built in storage and shelving.
A surprise in this property is the recently renovated self contained unit. The unit has two living spaces, kitchenette, generous bedroom with ensuite and a private entrance.
The home is surrounded by well established gardens, ideal for outside entertaining and will suit a range of buyers. A beautiful Californian Bungalow that offers so much more.
Insights: 5 other 5 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Sought-after location with loads of potential
Positioned in a lovely, quiet, tree-lined street, is this 1930's Californian Bungalow, offering the opportunity to enhance to its full potential with a modest upgrade in some areas, or with plenty of room to extend as well.
The home features formal lounge and dining rooms with beautifully polished flooring, high art-deco ceilings and original leadlight windows.
The entry also has polished floor boards, with the original untouched timber panelling that enhances the character of the home.
Offering 3 bedrooms, one is study-sized, but the front living room could also be reconfigured to make the home 3 bedrooms plus study and one living area.
This living area has original, built-in, buffet-styled cupboards with lead light doors, and a split-system cooler, plus the entire home has had ducted gas heating installed.
The bathroom is modest but practical with a shower over bath, vanity unit and 2nd toilet.
The kitchen is of a good size with an upright gas stove and built-in cupboards, and still leaving enough room for a table.
At the rear is an enclosed rear porch, with entry to the study, separate toilet and a spacious laundry.
The home has had many upgrades including a new roof, rewired, hot water service and all internal appliances.
An outside paint would certainly enhance its appearance, and allows you to pick your own colour scheme.
Located close to Bendigo South East campus, St Therese's and St Joseph's primary schools, is certainly a big plus for a family intending to reap the benefits of its location.
The home is just a short stroll to many of Bendigo's CBD attractions, and has recreational parks close by.
If you're looking for a home in the right location, and happy to do a little renovation or extension, look no further. Homes of this calibre and location are snapped up quickly, so your early inspection is highly recommended.
Insights: 9 Condon Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2017 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
STUNNING FAMILY HOME
This exceptional family home is in a sought after location being only minutes to La Trobe University , Bendigo Sth East College & Kennington Reservoir. The home features both formal & informal living spaces, a large central kitchen with excellent cupboard and bench space, 4 bedrooms plus study & master bedroom with ensuite. Evaporative cooling, gas ducted heating provide year round comfort while outside is an undercover entertaining area, double garage & workshop all set on a block of just under 1000m². Homes of this calibre are increasingly hard to acquire in this tightly held community of Kennington.
Note: ALL ENQUIRIES MUST INCLUDE A PHONE NUMBER
PHOTO ID REQUIRED AT INSPECTIONS

Description:
Kennington convenience with bush backdrop.
This fine family home has the best of both worlds – it enjoys the serene and leafy backdrop of the One Tree Hill section of the Greater Bendigo National Park and yet is still within walking distance to Kennington Village, Reservoir and all facilities.
Beyond the full-length front verandah and welcoming entry hall lies four bedrooms, L-shaped formal living and dining with feature brick open fireplace, spacious family room and kitchen/meals overlooking a rear pergola.
Recent renovations include a fabulous new ensuite and wall of fully-fitted robes to the main bedroom with new carpets and paintwork throughout. Solid timber kitchen is equipped with gas cooktop, electric oven, inverter microwave, dishwasher and big pantry cupboards while the adjoining meals area includes a built-in wall unit.
Outside is a nature lovers delight with plenty of birds and wildflowers peeking through the back fence. Enjoy lazy summer days by the sparkling kidney-shaped pool surrounded by paved, decked and grassy areas or dine alfresco under the pergola with the birds.
The fully landscaped 1814 square metre allotment includes a sweeping driveway to the double carport, ample off-street parking, large garden shed, vegetable gardens, rainwater tank, and a workshop with roller door for the handyman.
Perfectly positioned beside the National Park and close to La Trobe University, schools, shopping, s medical practice and just about everything a family could desire. Don't procrastinate – this one won't wait.
Insights: 85 Marnie Road, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2013 and 26 other 4 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
Classic Californian in a key position.
87 STERNBERG STREET, KENNINGTON $425,000
1930's brick and roughcast home may have all the external hallmarks of the Californian bungalow style but inside it has been respectfully renovated to suit a modern lifestyle. It features traditional wide entry hall with polished timber floors and high ceilings overhead.
Two big front bedrooms including the main with a wall of built-in robes and lovely curved, double-hung windows. Expansive, central lounge room boasts brick fireplace with gas log fire insert, original picture rails, decorative ceilings and cornice.
Improvements include ducted air conditioning throughout; the kitchen has new cabinetry, dishwasher, freestanding Emilia 900mm, gas/electric stove and plenty of room for dining.
Updated bathroom has shower over the bath, toilet and hand basin while an extension to the home incorporates third bedroom, big laundry and second bathroom with 1200mm shower, large vanity with twin basins and toilet.
Outdoors the securely fenced rear yard encompasses a covered outdoor living area, garden shed, single, lock-up carport and further off-street parking.
The key Kennington position is within walking distance to the CBD, public transport, Bendigo Railway Station, Bendigo Marketplace, Ewing Park and Harry Trott Oval.
Enjoy the ambience of an older style home with the benefits of today's modern creature comforts on a block size of 506m2.
87A STERNBERG STREET, KENNINGTON $160,000
There isn't much land left out there and this key Kennington position is ready and waiting. Situated on approx. 507m2 and within walking distance to the CBD, public transport, Railway Station, Bendigo Marketplace, Ewing Park and Harry Trott Oval this sweet spot on Sternberg street is the ideal location to build a home close to all things desirable.
87A is on a separate title to its neighbouring 1930's Californian Bungalow however there is also the option to buy this home. The opportunity is ripe to spread your wings in Kennington. Call today for more information.
Insights: 87 Sternberg Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2017 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
THE ADDRESS SAYS IT ALL
Perfectly positioned home has potential plus for first home owners, retirees or investors.
It offers four bedrooms (with robes), the main suite has a bay window framing the front garden and includes a sleek, light-filled new ensuite and walk-in robe.
Spacious formal lounge and dining room features a matching bay window and bi-fold timber doors separating it from the open family living, kitchen and meals areas.
The kitchen is kitted out with timber cabinetry, gas/electric cooking appliances Bosch dishwasher, island breakfast bar and access to a sun-drenched rear alfresco deck overlooking the very private backyard.
The home has great storage options with ducted heating and cooling throughout and fresh paintwork to all bedrooms.
Outside, there's a double, lock-up carport with a handy 4m x 3m brick workshop/storeroom/office located behind it while a stunning ornamental pistachio tree shades the secure backyard.
Beat the crowds to the open home - the blue-ribbon position is an easy walk to everything – shopping, schools, LaTrobe university, doctors, sporting facilities, Kennington Reservoir and public transport. Don't procrastinate – this one won't wait.

Description:
Executive Family Living on 1180m2
Set in a tightly held position, only 750m from Strath Village Shopping Centre is this prestigious family residence, showcasing a quality finish by a custom private builder.
- Set on a large 1180m2 allotment, and offering approx 30 squares of living.
- Comprises 4 spacious bedrooms with main including ensuite and walk in robe, open plan and sun filled kitchen/meals and family area, separate formal lounge, plus a third living/rumpus room.
- Quality inclusions throughout with high ceilings including, square set cornices, Tasmanian Oak polished timber flooring, ducted heating and cooling, and feature leadlight windows.
- Easy access to the scenic Kennington Reservoir (750m), gym, shopping, La Trobe University, schools, and only a short drive to the Bendigo CBD.
An exceptional property to suit the whole family, set amongst beautifully established gardens with a impressive street presence, in an exclusive part of popular Kennington.

Description:
Only 900m to the Bendigo CBD
Located in the heart of the city, is this neat, two bedroom brick veneer unit. The well maintained property comes with an updated kitchen, plus a spacious lounge with reverse cycle heating & cooling. The two bedrooms each have their own robes & are of a good size. The kitchen is in neutral colours with near new oven & a dishwasher. The bathroom also incorporates the laundry. Sitting on a larger than average size allotment, the unit has side access which would allow caravan or trailer access to the yard, something rarely found in properties like this. There's also an over sized garden shed & carport for garaging. With some recent painting, the property is ready to move into & enjoy. Alternatively with it's proximity to town, the university & hospital it would make an ideal investment opportunity with rental returns of around $240-$250 per week, which would make it a cash positive investment. A neat & tidy property in good condition, in a great location, inspection is recommended to fully appreciate all it has to offer.

Description:
SPACIOUS UNIT IN EXCELLENT ORDER
Tucked away at the rear of a lovely, quiet complex is this immaculate unit that is sure to impress even the fussiest of buyers. Private and secure, the property has been impeccably maintained and presents in excellent order throughout, allowing the purchaser to move in immediately with nothing left to spend. And with vacant possession available immediately, that's quite literally what you can do!
A light, bright and extra spacious floor plan (for a unit) awaits, and thanks to recent improvements, is as fresh and vibrant as the day it was built. New carpets have been laid, whilst the entire interior has been freshly painted. Ducted heating has been recently installed throughout to complement the air conditioner for full temperature control. Two or three bedrooms provide ample accommodation, all complete with built in robes and two have ceiling fans. The third bedroom located at the rear of the garage will serve as the perfect guest room or study if required. Convenient is the generous sized bathroom featuring shower and double vanity, with plenty of room still available to install a bath. At the centre of the home is the oversized open plan living hub, with loads of natural light pouring through feature bay window and sliding glass doors to outside. Sharing this space is the well appointed kitchen, boasting quality timber cabinetry, electric wall oven, gas hot plates and dishwasher. Adjacent is the laundry which has ample storage facilities – a feature consistent with the home.
Outdoors there is a sheltered patio area to enjoy entertaining through all seasons. The low maintenance yard is all you need to be able to lock and leave and come and go as you please without the worry. The established and easy care gardens are aesthetically pleasing, and have been set up to easily maintain thanks to the in-ground sprinkler system. A single garage with auto door provides secure parking, and has direct internal access to the home
Close to shops, transport and other major amenities, this spacious and immaculate unit is perfect for singles/couples of all ages, and is ideal for retirees or the elderly. Inspection is a must, as you wont find anything better on the market today!

Description:
Kennington Prime Position
A classic mid century styled home positioned within a short stroll from the Strath and Kennington Shopping Complexes is now on offer to astute investors or the keen buyer alike. Move quick on this one though because it wont last long!!
Modern updates throughout, featuring three good sized bedrooms. The master quite sizeable with plenty of robe space. Second lounge off the kitchen dining allows room to move for a growing family or teenage kids that need the extra space. The large kitchen offers breakky bench lip, pantry, ceramic cooktop and double doors leading to the outdoor alfresco entertaining area.
Split system heating and cooling providing comfort all year round. Internal drying cupboard and full laundry facilities.
Front balcony overlooking the quiet court location and underneath the double garage with access to additional storage and the stairwell leading up to the unique and intriguing front entry foyer.
A solidly built home with essence of the era and updates to bring it into the modern century. Fantastic sized and easy to maintain yard, this brick home will tick a lot of boxes for serious buyers among you.

Description:
Ticks a lot of buyer boxes
Whatever your reasons are for buying a property the 2 best assets for future capital growth are the location and allotment size anything else can be changed or improved. 52 Neale St Kennington offers both, location and allotment size plus comfortable living standard for owners or tenants.
Property Features
Less than 2km from the CBD.
Circa 1940's 2 bedroom painted red brick veneer home
Neat and tidy throughout with updated bathroom
High ceilings and hardwood floors
Gas heating and split system cooling
Good size entertainment deck
Allotment approx 660sqm with side access to rear
Single lock up garage
Opposite Harry Trott Sports Reserve
Current rent appraisal of $280 to $300pw

Description:
Stylish & Comfortable, City Edge Residence.
Perfectly positioned in a quiet street and only a short stroll to Bendigo CBD, this stylish and comfortable two-story townhouse hits the mark.
Features include:
- Three living areas, one near the entrance, the 2nd living area is at the rear of the home and is part of an open plan design incorporating the kitchen and dining. This space is private and allows access to a private, paved court yard. At the top of the stairs is a 3rd living area that opens up to an amazing balcony. The perfect place to relax with a cool drink behind the green foliage of established trees that line the street.
- The kitchen has an electric wall oven, gas cook top and dishwasher, plenty of bench space and cupboards, set up perfectly for entertaining.
- All three bedrooms are on the top level. Each of them has built in robes and would easily accommodate a queen size suite. The master has its own access to the balcony as well as access to the main two-way, 3-piece bathroom, as if it were an ensuite.
- The bathroom is comprised of bath, vanity and shower.
- Other highlights include; ducted heating and cooling throughout, an abundant of storage space, remote-control oversize single garage with interior access to the home, low maintenance, fully fenced and secure front and back yards.
Ideally suited to those with a busy lifestyle who like the convenience of having the city on your doorstep. Estimated rental $320 - $340 per week.
Insights: 2/10 Ligar Street, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2017 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
PRIME LOCATION, LOTS TO OFFER
If you get excited by the prospect of owning a home within walking distance to Kennington Reservoir, Shopping centre, La Trobe University and local schools then don't let this opportunity pass you by. This solid 3 bedroom brick veneer home will be suitable for most buyers.
The home boasts:
• A large open spacious living / dining area.
• Three bedrooms, two with built in robes.
• Three bathrooms. Ensuite with wheel chair access in the second bedroom. Main bathroom with shower, bath, vanity and toilet. Separate bathroom off the laundry with shower and toilet.
• Huge kitchen/dining area with plenty of storage and updated appliances.
• Central ducted gas heating and split systems.
• Split system and wall AC cooling.
• Spacious laundry with plenty of storage.
• Single electric roller door leads to the rear yard.
• 6m x 6m shed with power and concrete as well as a cedar cubby/studio.
• 3 plumbed 900 lt tanks.
• Security shutters and an alarm system.
Too much to mention be quick to arrange a personal inspection today.
